Comments_List: I learned how to perform separations analyses of complex chemical systems.
I learned about separations and the importance of this science in the world.
I learned important technical skills related to separating chemical components in systems.
Learning to program, really understanding and applying concepts
The course could be improved by splitting material more evenly throughout the semester.
Lots of material to cover, both a strength and weakness. Didn't like the textbook, very hard to decipher.
This course was pretty useless in the grand scheme of chemical engineering courses. It was also catered to graduate level and required way too much Matlab.
The workload was a bit too much
You should take this course in the senior year of your chemical engineering degree.
I would recommend this course to another student.  It is very interesting and intellectually stimulating.
Only if you need it to graduate

Have to take it for Chem E major.
